member.name: T:Cti.Stix.IStixBundle
member.summary: A Bundle is a collection of arbitrary STIX Objects grouped together in a single container

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.IStixBundle.Objects
member.summary: Specifies a set of one or more STIX Objects

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Bundle
member.summary:
A Bundle is a collection of arbitrary STIX Objects grouped together in a single container. A Bundle does not have any semantic meaning and the objects contained within the Bundle are not considered related by virtue of being in the same Bundle.
A STIX Bundle Object is not a STIX Object but makes use of the type and id Common Properties. A Bundle is transient, and implementations SHOULD NOT assume that other implementations will treat it as a persistent object or keep any custom properties found on the bundle itself.
The JSON MTI serialization uses the JSON Object type [RFC8259] when representing bundle.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Bundle.ObjectType
member.summary: The type property identifies the type of object. The value of this property MUST be bundle.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Bundle.ID
member.summary: An identifier for this Bundle. The id property for the Bundle is designed to help tools that may need it for processing, however, tools are not required to store or track it. Tools that consume STIX should not rely on the ability to refer to bundles by ID.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Bundle.Objects
member.summary: Specifies a set of one or more STIX Objects. Objects in this list MUST be a STIX Object.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.IScoStix
member.summary: STIX Cyber-observable Objects

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.ScoStix
member.summary:
STIX Cyber-observable Objects Objects that represent observed facts about a network or host that may be used and related to higher level intelligence to form a more complete understanding of the threat landscape.
STIX Cyber-observable Objects (SCOs) document the facts concerning what happened on a network or host, and do not capture the who, when, or why. By associating SCOs with STIX Domain Objects (SDOs), it is possible to convey a higher-level understanding of the threat landscape, and to potentially provide insight as to the who and the why particular intelligence may be relevant to an organization. For example, information about a file that existed, a process that was observed running, or that network traffic occurred between two IPs can all be captured as SCOs.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.ScoStix.SpecVersion
member.summary: The version of the STIX specification used to represent this object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.ScoStix.ObjectMarkingRefs
member.summary: The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.ScoStix.GranularMarkings
member.summary: The granular_markings property specifies a list of granular markings applied to this object.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Artifact
member.summary: The Artifact object permits capturing an array of bytes (8-bits), as a base64-encoded string, or linking to a file-like payload. One of payload_bin or url MUST be provided. It is incumbent on object creators to ensure that the URL is accessible for downstream consumers.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Artifact.MimeType
member.summary: Whenever feasible, this value SHOULD be one of the values defined in the Template column in the IANA media type registry [Media Types]. Maintaining a comprehensive universal catalog of all extant file types is obviously not possible. When specifying a MIME Type not included in the IANA registry, implementers should use their best judgement so as to facilitate interoperability.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Artifact.PayloadBin
member.summary: Specifies the binary data contained in the artifact as a base64-encoded string. This property MUST NOT be present if url is provided.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Artifact.Url
member.summary: The value of this property MUST be a valid URL that resolves to the unencoded content. This property MUST NOT be present if payload_bin is provided.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Artifact.Hashes
member.summary: Specifies a dictionary of hashes for the contents of the url or the payload_bin. This property MUST be present when the url property is present. Dictionary keys MUST come from the hash-algorithm-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Artifact.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: If the artifact is encrypted, specifies the type of encryption algorithm the binary data (either via payload_bin or url) is encoded in. The value of this property MUST come from the encryption-algorithm-enum enumeration. If both mime_type and encryption_algorithm are included, this signifies that the artifact represents an encrypted archive.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Artifact.decryption_key
member.summary: Specifies the decryption key for the encrypted binary data (either via payload_bin or url). For example, this may be useful in cases of sharing malware samples, which are often encoded in an encrypted archive. This property MUST NOT be present when the encryption_algorithm property is absent.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.AutonomousSystem
member.summary: This object represents the properties of an Autonomous System (AS).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.AutonomousSystem.Number
member.summary: Specifies the number assigned to the AS. Such assignments are typically performed by a Regional Internet Registry (RIR).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.AutonomousSystem.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the AS.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.AutonomousSystem.Rir
member.summary: Specifies the name of the Regional Internet Registry (RIR) that assigned the number to the AS.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Directory
member.summary: The Directory object represents the properties common to a file system directory.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Directory.Path
member.summary: Specifies the path, as originally observed, to the directory on the file system.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Directory.PathEnc
member.summary: Specifies the observed encoding for the path. The value MUST be specified if the path is stored in a non-Unicode encoding. This value MUST be specified using the corresponding name from the 2013-12-20 revision of the IANA character set registry [Character Sets]. If the preferred MIME name for a character set is defined, this value MUST be used; if it is not defined, then the Name value from the registry MUST be used instead.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Directory.CTime
member.summary: Specifies the date/time the directory was created.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Directory.MTime
member.summary: Specifies the date/time the directory was last written to/modified.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Directory.ATime
member.summary: Specifies the date/time the directory was last accessed.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Directory.ContainsRefs
member.summary: Specifies a list of references to other File and/or Directory objects contained within the directory. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type file or directory.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.DomainName
member.summary: The Domain Name object represents the properties of a network domain name.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.DomainName.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value of the domain name. The value of this property MUST conform to [RFC1034], and each domain and sub-domain contained within the domain name MUST conform to [RFC5890].

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.DomainName.ResolvesToRefs
member.summary: Specifies a list of references to one or more IP addresses or domain names that the domain name resolves to. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type ipv4-addr or ipv6-addr or domain-name (for cases such as CNAME records).

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailAddress
member.summary: The Email Address object represents a single email address.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailAddress.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value of the email address. This MUST NOT include the display name. This property corresponds to the addr-spec construction in section 3.4 of[RFC5322], for example, jane.smith @example.com.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailAddress.DisplayName
member.summary: Specifies a single email display name, i.e., the name that is displayed to the human user of a mail application. This property corresponds to the display-name construction in section 3.4 of [RFC5322], for example, Jane Smith.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailAddress.BelongsToRef
member.summary: Specifies the user account that the email address belongs to, as a reference to a User Account object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type user-account.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage
member.summary:
The Email Message object represents an instance of an email message, corresponding to the internet message format described in [RFC5322] and related RFCs.
Header field values that have been encoded as described in section 2 of [RFC2047] MUST be decoded before inclusion in Email Message object properties. For example, this is some text MUST be used instead of =?iso-8859-1?q?this=20is=20some=20text?=. Any characters in the encoded value which cannot be decoded into Unicode SHOULD be replaced with the 'REPLACEMENT CHARACTER' (U+FFFD). If it is necessary to capture the header value as observed, this can be achieved by referencing an Artifact object through the raw_email_ref property.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.IsMultipart
member.summary: Indicates whether the email body contains multiple MIME parts.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.Date
member.summary: Specifies the date/time that the email message was sent.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.ContentType
member.summary: Specifies the value of the "Content-Type" header of the email message.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.FromRef
member.summary:
Specifies the value of the "From:" header of the email message. The "From:" field specifies the author of the message, that is, the mailbox(es) of the person or system responsible for the writing of the message.
The object referenced in this property MUST be of type email-address.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.SenderRef
member.summary:
Specifies the value of the "Sender" field of the email message. The "Sender:" field specifies the mailbox of the agent responsible for the actual transmission of the message.
The object referenced in this property MUST be of type email-address.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.ToRefs
member.summary:
Specifies the mailboxes that are "To:" recipients of the email message.
The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type email-address.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.CcRefs
member.summary: Specifies the mailboxes that are "CC:" recipients of the email message. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type email-address.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.BccRefs
member.summary: Specifies the mailboxes that are "BCC:" recipients of the email message. As per [RFC5322], the absence of this property should not be interpreted as semantically equivalent to an absent BCC header on the message being characterized. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type email-address.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.MessageId
member.summary: Specifies the Message-ID field of the email message.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.Subject
member.summary: Specifies the subject of the email message.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.ReceivedLines
member.summary: Specifies one or more "Received" header fields that may be included in the email headers. List values MUST appear in the same order as present in the email message.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.AdditionalHeaderFields
member.summary:
Specifies any other header fields (except for date, received_lines, content_type, from_ref, sender_ref, to_refs, cc_refs, bcc_refs, and subject) found in the email message, as a dictionary.
Each key/value pair in the dictionary represents the name/value of a single header field or names/values of a header field that occurs more than once. Each dictionary key SHOULD be a case-preserved version of the header field name. The corresponding value for each dictionary key MUST always be a list of type string to support when a header field is repeated.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.Body
member.summary: Specifies a string containing the email body. This property MUST NOT be used if is_multipart is true.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.BodyMultipart
member.summary: Specifies a list of the MIME parts that make up the email body. This property MUST NOT be used if is_multipart is false.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.EmailMessage.RawEmailRef
member.summary: Specifies the raw binary contents of the email message, including both the headers and body, as a reference to an Artifact object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type artifact.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File
member.summary: The File object represents the properties of a file. A File object MUST contain at least one of hashes or name.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.Extensions
member.summary:
The File object defines the following extensions. In addition to these, producers MAY create their own. ntfs-ext, raster-image-ext, pdf-ext, archive-ext, windows-pebinary-ext
Dictionary keys MUST use the specification defined name (examples above) or be the id of a STIX Extension object, depending on the type of extension being used. The corresponding dictionary values MUST contain the contents of the extension instance.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.Hashes
member.summary: Specifies a dictionary of hashes for the file. (When used with the Archive File Extension, this refers to the hash of the entire archive file, not its contents.) Dictionary keys MUST come from the hash-algorithm-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of the file, in bytes. The value of this property MUST NOT be negative.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the file.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.NameEnc
member.summary:
Specifies the observed encoding for the name of the file. This value MUST be specified using the corresponding name from the 2013-12-20 revision of the IANA character set registry [Character Sets]. If the value from the Preferred MIME Name column for a character set is defined, this value MUST be used; if it is not defined, then the value from the Name column in the registry MUST be used instead.
This property allows for the capture of the original text encoding for the file name, which may be forensically relevant; for example, a file on an NTFS volume whose name was created using the windows-1251 encoding, commonly used for languages based on Cyrillic script.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.MagicNumberHex
member.summary: Specifies the hexadecimal constant ("magic number") associated with a specific file format that corresponds to the file, if applicable.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.MimeType
member.summary:
Specifies the MIME type name specified for the file, e.g., application/msword. Whenever feasible, this value SHOULD be one of the values defined in the Template column in the IANA media type registry [Media Types].
Maintaining a comprehensive universal catalog of all extant file types is obviously not possible. When specifying a MIME Type not included in the IANA registry, implementers should use their best judgement so as to facilitate interoperability.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.CTime
member.summary: Specifies the date/time the file was created.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.MTime
member.summary: Specifies the date/time the file was last written to/modified.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.ATime
member.summary: Specifies the date/time the file was last accessed.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.ParentDirectoryRef
member.summary: Specifies the parent directory of the file, as a reference to a Directory object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type directory.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.ContainsRefs
member.summary: Specifies a list of references to other Cyber-observable Objects contained within the file, such as another file that is appended to the end of the file, or an IP address that is contained somewhere in the file. This is intended for use cases other than those targeted by the Archive extension.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.File.ContentRef
member.summary: Specifies the content of the file, represented as an Artifact object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type artifact.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Ipv4
member.summary: The IPv4 Address object represents one or more IPv4 addresses expressed using CIDR notation.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Ipv4.Value
member.summary: Specifies the values of one or more IPv4 addresses expressed using CIDR notation. If a given IPv4 Address object represents a single IPv4 address, the CIDR /32 suffix MAY be omitted. Example: 10.2.4.5/24

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Ipv4.ResolvesToRefs
member.summary: Specifies a list of references to one or more Layer 2 Media Access Control (MAC) addresses that the IPv4 address resolves to. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type mac-addr.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Ipv4.BelongsToRefs
member.summary: Specifies a list of references to one or more autonomous systems (AS) that the IPv4 address belongs to. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type autonomous-system.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Ipv6
member.summary: The IPv6 Address object represents one or more IPv6 addresses expressed using CIDR notation.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Ipv6.Value
member.summary: Specifies the values of one or more IPv6 addresses expressed using CIDR notation. If a given IPv6 Address object represents a single IPv6 address, the CIDR /128 suffix MAY be omitted.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Ipv6.ResolvesToRefs
member.summary: Specifies a list of references to one or more Layer 2 Media Access Control (MAC) addresses that the IPv6 address resolves to. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type mac-addr.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Ipv6.BelongsToRefs
member.summary: Specifies a list of references to one or more autonomous systems (AS) that the IPv6 address belongs to. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type autonomous-system.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.MacAddress
member.summary: The MAC Address object represents a single Media Access Control (MAC) address.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.MacAddress.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value of a single MAC address. The MAC address value MUST be represented as a single colon-delimited, lowercase MAC-48 address, which MUST include leading zeros for each octet. Example: 00:00:ab:cd:ef:01

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Mutex
member.summary: The Mutex object represents the properties of a mutual exclusion (mutex) object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Mutex.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the mutex object.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic
member.summary:
The Network Traffic object represents arbitrary network traffic that originates from a source and is addressed to a destination. The network traffic MAY or MAY NOT constitute a valid unicast, multicast, or broadcast network connection. This MAY also include traffic that is not established, such as a SYN flood.
To allow for use cases where a source or destination address may be sensitive and not suitable for sharing, such as addresses that are internal to an organization’s network, the source and destination properties (src_ref and dst_ref, respectively) are defined as optional in the properties table below. However, a Network Traffic object MUST contain the protocols property and at least one of the src_ref or dst_ref properties and SHOULD contain the src_port and dst_port properties.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.Extensions
member.summary:
The Network Traffic object defines the following extensions. In addition to these, producers MAY create their own. http-request-ext, tcp-ext, icmp-ext, socket-ext
Dictionary keys MUST use the specification defined name (examples above) or be the id of a STIX Extension object, depending on the type of extension being used.
The corresponding dictionary values MUST contain the contents of the extension instance.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.Start
member.summary: Specifies the date/time the network traffic was initiated, if known.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.End
member.summary: Specifies the date/time the network traffic ended, if known. If the is_active property is true, then the end property MUST NOT be included. If this property and the start property are both defined, then this property MUST be greater than or equal to the timestamp in the start property.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.IsActive
member.summary: Indicates whether the network traffic is still ongoing. If the end property is provided, this property MUST be false.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.SrcRef
member.summary: Specifies the source of the network traffic, as a reference to a Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced MUST be of type ipv4-addr, ipv6-addr, mac-addr, or domain-name (for cases where the IP address for a domain name is unknown).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.DstRef
member.summary: Specifies the destination of the network traffic, as a reference to a Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced MUST be of type ipv4-addr, ipv6-addr, mac-addr, or domain-name (for cases where the IP address for a domain name is unknown).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.SrcPort
member.summary: Specifies the source port used in the network traffic, as an integer. The port value MUST be in the range of 0 - 65535.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.DstPort
member.summary: Specifies the destination port used in the network traffic, as an integer. The port value MUST be in the range of 0 - 65535.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.Protocols
member.summary:
Specifies the protocols observed in the network traffic, along with their corresponding state. Protocols MUST be listed in low to high order, from outer to inner in terms of packet encapsulation. That is, the protocols in the outer level of the packet, such as IP, MUST be listed first. The protocol names SHOULD come from the service names defined in the Service Name column of the IANA Service Name and Port Number Registry [Port Numbers]. In cases where there is variance in the name of a network protocol not included in the IANA Registry, content producers should exercise their best judgement, and it is recommended that lowercase names be used for consistency with the IANA registry.
If the protocol extension is present, the corresponding protocol value for that extension SHOULD be listed in this property. Examples: ipv4, tcp, http ipv4, udp ipv6, tcp, http ipv6, tcp, ssl, https

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.SrcByteCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of bytes, as a positive integer, sent from the source to the destination.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.DstByteCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of bytes, as a positive integer, sent from the destination to the source.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.SrcPackets
member.summary: Specifies the number of packets, as a positive integer, sent from the source to the destination.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.DstPackets
member.summary: Specifies the number of packets, as a positive integer, sent from the destination to the source.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.Ipfix
member.summary: Specifies any IP Flow Information Export [IPFIX] data for the traffic, as a dictionary. Each key/value pair in the dictionary represents the name/value of a single IPFIX element. Accordingly, each dictionary key SHOULD be a case-preserved version of the IPFIX element name, e.g., octetDeltaCount. Each dictionary value MUST be either an integer or a string, as well as a valid IPFIX property.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.SrcPayloadRef
member.summary: Specifies the bytes sent from the source to the destination. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type artifact.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.DstPayloadRef
member.summary: Specifies the bytes sent from the destination to the source. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type artifact.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.EncapsulatesRefs
member.summary: Links to other network-traffic objects encapsulated by this network-traffic object. The objects referenced in this property MUST be of type network-traffic.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkTraffic.EncapsulatedByRef
member.summary: Links to another network-traffic object which encapsulates this object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type network-traffic.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.HttpRequestExtensions
member.summary: The HTTP request extension specifies a default extension for capturing network traffic properties specific to HTTP requests. The key for this extension when used in the extensions dictionary MUST be http-request-ext. Note that this predefined extension does not use the extension facility described in section 7.3. The corresponding protocol value for this extension is http.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.IcmpExtensions
member.summary: The ICMP extension specifies a default extension for capturing network traffic properties specific to ICMP. The key for this extension when used in the extensions dictionary MUST be icmp-ext. Note that this predefined extension does not use the extension facility described in section 7.3. The corresponding protocol value for this extension is icmp.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.NetworkSocketExtension
member.summary: The Network Socket extension specifies a default extension for capturing network traffic properties associated with network sockets. The key for this extension when used in the extensions dictionary MUST be socket-ext. Note that this predefined extension does not use the extension facility described in section 7.3.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.TcpExtensions
member.summary: The TCP extension specifies a default extension for capturing network traffic properties specific to TCP. The key for this extension when used in the extensions dictionary MUST be tcp-ext. Note that this predefined extension does not use the extension facility described in section 7.3. The corresponding protocol value for this extension is tcp. An object using the TCP Extension MUST contain at least one property from this extension.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process
member.summary: The Process object represents common properties of an instance of a computer program as executed on an operating system. A Process object MUST contain at least one property (other than type) from this object (or one of its extensions).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.Extensions
member.summary: The Process object defines the following extensions. In addition to these, producers MAY create their own. windows-process-ext, windows-service-ext Dictionary keys MUST use the specification defined name (examples above) or be the id of a STIX Extension object, depending on the type of extension being used. The corresponding dictionary values MUST contain the contents of the extension instance.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.IsHidden
member.summary: Specifies whether the process is hidden.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.Pid
member.summary: Specifies the Process ID, or PID, of the process.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.CreatedTime
member.summary: Specifies the date/time at which the process was created.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.Cwd
member.summary: Specifies the current working directory of the process.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.CommandLine
member.summary: Specifies the full command line used in executing the process, including the process name (which may be specified individually via the image_ref.name property) and any arguments.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.EnvironmentVariables
member.summary: Specifies the list of environment variables associated with the process as a dictionary. Each key in the dictionary MUST be a case preserved version of the name of the environment variable, and each corresponding value MUST be the environment variable value as a string.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.OpenedConnectionRefs
member.summary: Specifies the list of network connections opened by the process, as a reference to one or more Network Traffic objects. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type network-traffic.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.CreatorUserRef
member.summary: Specifies the user that created the process, as a reference to a User Account object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type user-account.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.ImageRef
member.summary: Specifies the executable binary that was executed as the process image, as a reference to a File object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type file.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.ParentRef
member.summary: Specifies the other process that spawned (i.e. is the parent of) this one, as a reference to a Process object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type process.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Process.ChildRefs
member.summary: Specifies the other processes that were spawned by (i.e. children of) this process, as a reference to one or more other Process objects. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type process.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.WindowsProcessExtension
member.summary: The Windows Process extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to Windows processes. The key for this extension when used in the extensions dictionary MUST be windows-process-ext. Note that this predefined extension does not use the extension facility described in section 7.3. An object using the Windows Process Extension MUST contain at least one property from this extension.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.WindowsServiceExtension
member.summary: The Windows Service extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to Windows services. The key for this extension when used in the extensions dictionary MUST be windows-service-ext. Note that this predefined extension does not use the extension facility described in section 7.3. As all properties of this extension are optional, at least one of the properties defined below MUST be included when using this extension.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Software
member.summary: The Software object represents high-level properties associated with software, including software products.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Software.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the software.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Software.Cpe
member.summary: Specifies the Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) entry for the software, if available. The value for this property MUST be a CPE v2.3 entry from the official NVD CPE Dictionary [NVD] . While the CPE dictionary does not contain entries for all software, whenever it does contain an identifier for a given instance of software, this property SHOULD be present.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Software.Swid
member.summary: Specifies the Software Identification (SWID) Tags [SWID] entry for the software, if available. The tag attribute, tagId, a globally unique identifier, SHOULD be used as a proxy identifier of the tagged product.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Software.Languages
member.summary: Specifies the languages supported by the software. The value of each list member MUST be a language code conformant to [RFC5646].

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Software.Vendor
member.summary: Specifies the name of the vendor of the software.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Software.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version of the software.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Url
member.summary: The URL object represents the properties of a uniform resource locator (URL).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.Url.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value of the URL. The value of this property MUST conform to [RFC3986], more specifically section 1.1.3 with reference to the definition for "Uniform Resource Locator".

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount
member.summary: The User Account object represents an instance of any type of user account, including but not limited to operating system, device, messaging service, and social media platform accounts. As all properties of this object are optional, at least one of the properties defined below MUST be included when using this object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.Extensions
member.summary: The User Account object defines the following extensions. In addition to these, producers MAY create their own. unix-account-ext Dictionary keys MUST use the specification defined name (examples above) or be the id of a STIX Extension object, depending on the type of extension being used. The corresponding dictionary values MUST contain the contents of the extension instance.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.UserId
member.summary: Specifies the identifier of the account. The format of the identifier depends on the system the user account is maintained in, and may be a numeric ID, a GUID, an account name, an email address, etc. The user_id property should be populated with whatever field is the unique identifier for the system the account is a member of. For example, on UNIX systems it would be populated with the UID.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.Credential
member.summary: Specifies a cleartext credential. This is only intended to be used in capturing metadata from malware analysis (e.g., a hard-coded domain administrator password that the malware attempts to use for lateral movement) and SHOULD NOT be used for sharing of PII.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.AccountLogin
member.summary: Specifies the account login string, used in cases where the user_id property specifies something other than what a user would type when they login. For example, in the case of a Unix account with user_id 0, the account_login might be "root".

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.AccountType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the account. This is an open vocabulary and values SHOULD come from the account-type-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.DisplayName
member.summary: Specifies the display name of the account, to be shown in user interfaces, if applicable. On Unix, this is equivalent to the GECOS field.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.IsServiceAccount
member.summary: Indicates that the account is associated with a network service or system process (daemon), not a specific individual.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.IsPrivileged
member.summary: Specifies that the account has elevated privileges (i.e., in the case of root on Unix or the Windows Administrator account).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.CanEscalatePrivs
member.summary: Specifies that the account has the ability to escalate privileges (i.e., in the case of sudo on Unix or a Windows Domain Admin account)

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.IsDisabled
member.summary: Specifies if the account is disabled.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.AccountCreated
member.summary: Specifies when the account was created.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.AccountExpires
member.summary: Specifies the expiration date of the account.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.CredentialLastChanged
member.summary: Specifies when the account credential was last changed.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.AccountFirstLogin
member.summary: Specifies when the account was first accessed.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UserAccount.AccountLastLogin
member.summary: Specifies when the account was last accessed.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.UNIXAccountExtension
member.summary: The UNIX account extension specifies a default extension for capturing the additional information for an account on a UNIX system. The key for this extension when used in the extensions dictionary MUST be unix-account-ext. Note that this predefined extension does not use the extension facility described in section 7.3. An object using the UNIX Account Extension MUST contain at least one property from this extension.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.WindowsRegistryKey
member.summary: The Registry Key object represents the properties of a Windows registry key. As all properties of this object are optional, at least one of the properties defined below MUST be included when using this object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.WindowsRegistryKey.Key
member.summary: Specifies the full registry key including the hive. The value of the key, including the hive portion, SHOULD be case-preserved. The hive portion of the key MUST be fully expanded and not truncated; e.g., HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE must be used instead of HKLM.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.WindowsRegistryKey.Values
member.summary: Specifies the values found under the registry key.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.WindowsRegistryKey.ModifiedTime
member.summary: Specifies the last date/time that the registry key was modified.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.WindowsRegistryKey.CreatorUserRef
member.summary: Specifies a reference to the user account that created the registry key. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type user-account.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.WindowsRegistryKey.NumberOfSubkeys
member.summary: Specifies the number of subkeys contained under the registry key.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate
member.summary: The X.509 Certificate object represents the properties of an X.509 certificate, as defined by ITU recommendation X.509 [X.509]. An X.509 Certificate object MUST contain at least one object specific property (other than type) from this object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.IsSelfSigned
member.summary: Specifies whether the certificate is self-signed, i.e., whether it is signed by the same entity whose identity it certifies.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.Hashes
member.summary: Specifies any hashes that were calculated for the entire contents of the certificate. Dictionary keys MUST come from the hash-algorithm-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version of the encoded certificate.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.SerialNumber
member.summary: Specifies the unique identifier for the certificate, as issued by a specific Certificate Authority.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.SignatureAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the name of the algorithm used to sign the certificate.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.Issuer
member.summary: Specifies the name of the Certificate Authority that issued the certificate.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.ValidityNotBefore
member.summary: Specifies the date on which the certificate validity period begins.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.ValidityNotAfter
member.summary: Specifies the date on which the certificate validity period ends.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.Subject
member.summary: Specifies the name of the entity associated with the public key stored in the subject public key field of the certificate.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.SubjectPublicKeyAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the name of the algorithm with which to encrypt data being sent to the subject.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.SubjectPublicKeyModulus
member.summary: Specifies the modulus portion of the subject’s public RSA key.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.SubjectPublicKeyExponent
member.summary: Specifies the exponent portion of the subject’s public RSA key, as an integer.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SCO.X509Certificate.X509V3Extensions
member.summary: Specifies any standard X.509 v3 extensions that may be used in the certificate.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.ISdoStix
member.summary: STIX Domain Objects

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix
member.summary: STIX Domain Objects Higher Level Intelligence Objects that represent behaviors and constructs that threat analysts would typically create or work with while understanding the threat landscape.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.SpecVersion
member.summary: The version of the STIX specification used to represent this object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.CreatedByRef
member.summary:
The created_by_ref property specifies the id property of the identity object that describes the entity that created this object.
related-to

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.Created
member.summary: The created property represents the time at which the object was originally created.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.Modified
member.summary: The modified property is only used by STIX Objects that support versioning and represents the time that this particular version of the object was last modified.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.Revoked
member.summary: The revoked property is only used by STIX Objects that support versioning and indicates whether the object has been revoked.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.Labels
member.summary: The labels property specifies a set of terms used to describe this object. The terms are user-defined or trust-group defined and their meaning is outside the scope of this specification and MAY be ignored.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.Confidence
member.summary: The confidence property identifies the confidence that the creator has in the correctness of their data. The confidence value MUST be a number in the range of 0-100.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.Lang
member.summary: The lang property identifies the language of the text content in this object. When present, it MUST be a language code conformant to [RFC5646]. If the property is not present, then the language of the content is en (English).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.ExternalReferences
member.summary: The external_references property specifies a list of external references which refers to non-STIX information. This property is used to provide one or more URLs, descriptions, or IDs to records in other systems.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.ObjectMarkingRefs
member.summary:
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
related-to

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.GranularMarkings
member.summary: The granular_markings property specifies a list of granular markings applied to this object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SdoStix.Extensions
member.summary: Specifies any extensions of the object, as a dictionary. Dictionary keys SHOULD be the id of a STIX Extension object or the name of a predefined object extension found in this specification, depending on the type of extension being used.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.AttackPattern
member.summary: Attack Patterns are a type of TTP that describe ways that adversaries attempt to compromise targets. Attack Patterns are used to help categorize attacks, generalize specific attacks to the patterns that they follow, and provide detailed information about how attacks are performed. An example of an attack pattern is "spear phishing": a common type of attack where an attacker sends a carefully crafted e-mail message to a party with the intent of getting them to click a link or open an attachment to deliver malware. Attack Patterns can also be more specific; spear phishing as practiced by a particular threat actor (e.g., they might generally say that the target won a contest) can also be an Attack Pattern.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.AttackPattern.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the Attack Pattern.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.AttackPattern.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Attack Pattern, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.AttackPattern.Aliases
member.summary: Alternative names used to identify this Attack Pattern.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.AttackPattern.KillChainPhases
member.summary: The list of Kill Chain Phases for which this Attack Pattern is used.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.AttackPattern.ExternalReferences
member.summary: A list of external references which refer to non-STIX information. This property MAY be used to provide one or more Attack Pattern identifiers, such as a CAPEC ID. When specifying a CAPEC ID, the source_name property of the external reference MUST be set to capec and the external_id property MUST be formatted as CAPEC-[id].

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Campaign
member.summary:
A Campaign is a grouping of adversarial behaviors that describes a set of malicious activities or attacks (sometimes called waves) that occur over a period of time against a specific set of targets. Campaigns usually have well defined objectives and may be part of an Intrusion Set.
Campaigns are often attributed to an intrusion set and threat actors. The threat actors may reuse known infrastructure from the intrusion set or may set up new infrastructure specific for conducting that campaign.
Campaigns can be characterized by their objectives and the incidents they cause, people or resources they target, and the resources (infrastructure, intelligence, Malware, Tools, etc.) they use.
For example, a Campaign could be used to describe a crime syndicate's attack using a specific variant of malware and new C2 servers against the executives of ACME Bank during the summer of 2016 in order to gain secret information about an upcoming merger with another bank.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Campaign.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the Campaign.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Campaign.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Campaign, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Campaign.Aliases
member.summary: Alternative names used to identify this Campaign

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Campaign.FirstSeen
member.summary: The time that this Campaign was first seen. A summary property of data from sightings and other data that may or may not be available in STIX.If new sightings are received that are earlier than the first seen timestamp, the object may be updated to account for the new data.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Campaign.LastSeen
member.summary: The time that this Campaign was last seen. A summary property of data from sightings and other data that may or may not be available in STIX.If new sightings are received that are later than the last seen timestamp, the object may be updated to account for the new data. If this property and the first_seen property are both defined, then this property MUST be greater than or equal to the timestamp in the first_seen property.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Campaign.Objective
member.summary: The Campaign’s primary goal, objective, desired outcome, or intended effect — what the Threat Actor or Intrusion Set hopes to accomplish with this Campaign.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.CourseOfAction
member.summary:
The Course of Action object in STIX 2.1 is a stub. It is included to support basic use cases (such as sharing prose courses of action) but does not support the ability to represent automated courses of action or contain properties to represent metadata about courses of action. Future STIX 2 releases will expand it to include these capabilities.
A Course of Action is an action taken either to prevent an attack or to respond to an attack that is in progress. It may describe technical, automatable responses (applying patches, reconfiguring firewalls) but can also describe higher level actions like employee training or policy changes. For example, a course of action to mitigate a vulnerability could describe applying the patch that fixes it.
The Course of Action SDO contains a textual description of the action; a reserved action property also serves as a placeholder for future inclusion of machine automatable courses of action.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.CourseOfAction.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the Course of Action.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.CourseOfAction.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Course of Action, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Grouping
member.summary:
A Grouping object explicitly asserts that the referenced STIX Objects have a shared context, unlike a STIX Bundle (which explicitly conveys no context). A Grouping object should not be confused with an intelligence product, which should be conveyed via a STIX Report.
A STIX Grouping object might represent a set of data that, in time, given sufficient analysis, would mature to convey an incident or threat report as a STIX Report object. For example, a Grouping could be used to characterize an ongoing investigation into a security event or incident. A Grouping object could also be used to assert that the referenced STIX Objects are related to an ongoing analysis process, such as when a threat analyst is collaborating with others in their trust community to examine a series of Campaigns and Indicators. The Grouping SDO contains a list of references to SDOs, SCOs, SROs, and SMOs, along with an explicit statement of the context shared by the content, a textual description, and the name of the grouping.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Grouping.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the Grouping.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Grouping.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Grouping, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Grouping.Context
member.summary: A short descriptor of the particular context shared by the content referenced by the Grouping. The value for this property SHOULD come from the grouping-context-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Grouping.ObjectRefs
member.summary: Specifies the STIX Objects that are referred to by this Grouping.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Identity
member.summary:
Identities can represent actual individuals, organizations, or groups (e.g., ACME, Inc.) as well as classes of individuals, organizations, systems or groups (e.g., the finance sector).
The Identity SDO can capture basic identifying information, contact information, and the sectors that the Identity belongs to. Identity is used in STIX to represent, among other things, targets of attacks, information sources, object creators, and threat actor identities.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Identity.Name
member.summary: The name of this Identity. When referring to a specific entity (e.g., an individual or organization), this property SHOULD contain the canonical name of the specific entity.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Identity.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Identity, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Identity.Roles
member.summary: The list of roles that this Identity performs (e.g., CEO, Domain Administrators, Doctors, Hospital, or Retailer). No open vocabulary is yet defined for this property.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Identity.IdentityClass
member.summary: The type of entity that this Identity describes, e.g., an individual or organization.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Identity.Sectors
member.summary: The list of industry sectors that this Identity belongs to.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Identity.ContactInformation
member.summary: The contact information (e-mail, phone number, etc.) for this Identity. No format for this information is currently defined by this specification.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Incident
member.summary: The Incident object in STIX 2.1 is a stub. It is included to support basic use cases but does not contain properties to represent metadata about incidents. Future STIX 2 releases will expand it to include these capabilities. It is suggested that it is used as an extension point for an Incident object defined using the extension facility described in section 7.3.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Incident.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the Incident.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Incident.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Incident, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator
member.summary:
Indicators contain a pattern that can be used to detect suspicious or malicious cyber activity. For example, an Indicator may be used to represent a set of malicious domains and use the STIX Patterning Language (see section 9) to specify these domains.
The Indicator SDO contains a simple textual description, the Kill Chain Phases that it detects behavior in, a time window for when the Indicator is valid or useful, and a required pattern property to capture a structured detection pattern. Conforming STIX implementations MUST support the STIX Patterning Language as defined in section 9.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the Indicator.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Indicator, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.IndicatorTypes
member.summary: A name used to identify the Indicator.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.Pattern
member.summary: The detection pattern for this Indicator MAY be expressed as a STIX Pattern as specified in section 9 or another appropriate language such as SNORT, YARA, etc.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.PatternType
member.summary: The pattern language used in this indicator.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.PatternVersion
member.summary: The version of the pattern language that is used for the data in the pattern property which MUST match the type of pattern data included in the pattern property.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.ValidFrom
member.summary: The time from which this Indicator is considered a valid indicator of the behaviors it is related or represents.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.ValidUntil
member.summary: The time at which this Indicator should no longer be considered a valid indicator of the behaviors it is related to or represents.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Indicator.KillChainPhases
member.summary: The kill chain phase(s) to which this Indicator corresponds.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Infrastructure
member.summary: The Infrastructure SDO represents a type of TTP and describes any systems, software services and any associated physical or virtual resources intended to support some purpose (e.g., C2 servers used as part of an attack, device or server that are part of defense, database servers targeted by an attack, etc.). While elements of an attack can be represented by other SDOs or SCOs, the Infrastructure SDO represents a named group of related data that constitutes the infrastructure.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Infrastructure.Name
member.summary: A name or characterizing text used to identify the Infrastructure.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Infrastructure.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Infrastructure, potentially including its purpose, how it is being used, how it relates to other intelligence activities captured in related objects, and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Infrastructure.InfrastructureTypes
member.summary: The type of infrastructure being described.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Infrastructure.Aliases
member.summary: Alternative names used to identify this Infrastructure.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Infrastructure.KillChainPhases
member.summary: The list of Kill Chain Phases for which this Infrastructure is used.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Infrastructure.FirstSeen
member.summary: The time that this Infrastructure was first seen performing malicious activities.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Infrastructure.LastSeen
member.summary: The time that this Infrastructure was last seen performing malicious activities. If this property and the first_seen property are both defined, then this property MUST be greater than or equal to the timestamp in the first_seen property.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet
member.summary: An Intrusion Set is a grouped set of adversarial behaviors and resources with common properties that is believed to be orchestrated by a single organization. An Intrusion Set may capture multiple Campaigns or other activities that are all tied together by shared attributes indicating a commonly known or unknown Threat Actor. New activity can be attributed to an Intrusion Set even if the Threat Actors behind the attack are not known. Threat Actors can move from supporting one Intrusion Set to supporting another, or they may support multiple Intrusion Sets.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify this Intrusion Set.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Intrusion Set, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.Aliases
member.summary: Alternative names used to identify this Intrusion Set.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.FirstSeen
member.summary: The time that this Intrusion Set was first seen.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.LastSeen
member.summary: The time that this Intrusion Set was last seen.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.Goals
member.summary: The high-level goals of this Intrusion Set, namely, what are they trying to do. For example, they may be motivated by personal gain, but their goal is to steal credit card numbers. To do this, they may execute specific Campaigns that have detailed objectives like compromising point of sale systems at a large retailer.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.ResourceLevel
member.summary: This property specifies the organizational level at which this Intrusion Set typically works, which in turn determines the resources available to this Intrusion Set for use in an attack.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.PrimaryMotivation
member.summary: The primary reason, motivation, or purpose behind this Intrusion Set. The motivation is why the Intrusion Set wishes to achieve the goal (what they are trying to achieve).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.IntrusionSet.SecondaryMotivation
member.summary: The secondary reasons, motivations, or purposes behind this Intrusion Set. These motivations can exist as an equal or near-equal cause to the primary motivation. However, it does not replace or necessarily magnify the primary motivation, but it might indicate additional context. The position in the list has no significance.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location
member.summary:
A Location represents a geographic location. The location may be described as any, some or all of the following: region (e.g., North America), civic address (e.g. New York, US), latitude and longitude.
At least one of the following properties/sets of properties MUST be provided: - region - country - latitude and longitude

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the Location.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the Location.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude of the Location in decimal degrees. Positive numbers describe latitudes north of the equator, and negative numbers describe latitudes south of the equator. The value of this property MUST be between -90.0 and 90.0, inclusive.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude of the Location in decimal degrees. Positive numbers describe longitudes east of the prime meridian and negative numbers describe longitudes west of the prime meridian. The value of this property MUST be between -180.0 and 180.0, inclusive.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.Precision
member.summary: Defines the precision of the coordinates specified by the latitude and longitude properties. This is measured in meters. The actual Location may be anywhere up to precision meters from the defined point.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.Region
member.summary: The region that this Location describes.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.Country
member.summary: The country that this Location describes This property SHOULD contain a valid ISO 3166-1 ALPHA-2 Code

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.AdministrativeArea
member.summary: The state, province, or other sub-national administrative area that this Location describes. This property SHOULD contain a valid ISO 3166-2 Code

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.City
member.summary: The city that this Location describes.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.StreetAddress
member.summary: The street address that this Location describes. This property includes all aspects or parts of the street address. For example, some addresses may have multiple lines including a mailstop or apartment number.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Location.PostalCode
member.summary: The postal code for this Location.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware
member.summary: Malware is a type of TTP that represents malicious code. It generally refers to a program that is inserted into a system, usually covertly. The intent is to compromise the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of the victim's data, applications, or operating system (OS) or otherwise annoy or disrupt the victim.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the malware instance or family, as specified by the producer of the SDO. For a malware family the name MUST be defined. If a name for a malware instance is not available, the SHA-256 hash value or sample’s filename MAY be used instead.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the malware instance or family, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.MalwareTypes
member.summary: A set of categorizations for the malware being described.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.IsFamily
member.summary: Whether the object represents a malware family (if true) or a malware instance (if false).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.Aliases
member.summary: Alternative names used to identify this malware or malware family.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.KillChainPhases
member.summary: The list of Kill Chain Phases for which this malware can be used.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.FirstSeen
member.summary: The time that the malware instance or family was first seen. This property is a summary property of data from sightings and other data that may or may not be available in STIX. If new sightings are received that are earlier than the first seen timestamp, the object may be updated to account for the new data.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.LastSeen
member.summary: The time that the malware family or malware instance was last seen. This property is a summary property of data from sightings and other data that may or may not be available in STIX. If new sightings are received that are later than the last_seen timestamp, the object may be updated to account for the new data. If this property and the first_seen property are both defined, then this property MUST be greater than or equal to the timestamp in the first_seen property.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.OperatingSystemRefs
member.summary: The operating systems that the malware family or malware instance is executable on. This applies to virtualized operating systems as well as those running on bare metal.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.ArchitectureExecutionEnvs
member.summary: The processor architectures (e.g., x86, ARM, etc.) that the malware instance or family is executable on. The values for this property SHOULD come from the processor-architecture-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.ImplementationLanguages
member.summary: The programming language(s) used to implement the malware instance or family. The values for this property SHOULD come from the implementation-language-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.Capabilities
member.summary: Any of the capabilities identified for the malware instance or family. The values for this property SHOULD come from the malware-capabilities-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Malware.SampleRefs
member.summary: The sample_refs property specifies a list of identifiers of the SCO file or artifact objects associated with this malware instance(s) or family. If is_family is false, then all samples listed in sample_refs MUST refer to the same binary data.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis
member.summary: Malware Analysis captures the metadata and results of a particular static or dynamic analysis performed on a malware instance or family. One of result or analysis_sco_refs properties MUST be provided.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.Product
member.summary: The name of the analysis engine or product that was used. Product names SHOULD be all lowercase with words separated by a dash "-". For cases where the name of a product cannot be specified, a value of "anonymized" MUST be used.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.Version
member.summary: The version of the analysis product that was used to perform the analysis.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.HostVmRef
member.summary:
A description of the virtual machine environment used to host the guest operating system (if applicable) that was used for the dynamic analysis of the malware instance or family.
If this value is not included in conjunction with the operating_system_ref property, this means that the dynamic analysis may have been performed on bare metal (i.e. without virtualization) or the information was redacted.
The value of this property MUST be the identifier for a SCO software object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.OperatingSystemRef
member.summary:
The operating system used for the dynamic analysis of the malware instance or family. This applies to virtualized operating systems as well as those running on bare metal.
The value of this property MUST be the identifier for a SCO software object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.InstalledSoftwareRefs
member.summary:
Any non-standard software installed on the operating system (specified through the operating-system value) used for the dynamic analysis of the malware instance or family.
The value of this property MUST be the identifier for a SCO software object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.ConfigurationVersion
member.summary:
The named configuration of additional product configuration parameters for this analysis run.
For example, when a product is configured to do full depth analysis of Window™ PE files. This configuration may have a named version and that named version can be captured in this property. This will ensure additional runs can be configured in the same way.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.Modules
member.summary: The specific analysis modules that were used and configured in the product during this analysis run. For example, configuring a product to support analysis of Dridex.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.AnalysisEngineVersion
member.summary: The version of the analysis engine or product (including AV engines) that was used to perform the analysis.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.AnalysisDefinitionVersion
member.summary: The version of the analysis definitions used by the analysis tool (including AV tools).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.Submitted
member.summary: The date and time that the malware was first submitted for scanning or analysis. This value will stay constant while the scanned date can change. For example, when Malware was submitted to a virus analysis tool.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.AnalysisStarted
member.summary: The date and time that the malware analysis was initiated.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.AnalysisEnded
member.summary: The date and time that the malware analysis ended.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.ResultName
member.summary: The classification result or name assigned to the malware instance by the scanner tool.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.Result
member.summary:
The classification result as determined by the scanner or tool analysis process.
The value for this property SHOULD come from the malware-result-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.AnalysisScoRefs
member.summary: This property contains the references to the STIX Cyber-observable Objects that were captured during the analysis process.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.MalwareAnalysis.SampleRef
member.summary:
This property contains the reference to the SCO file, network traffic or artifact object that this malware analysis was performed against.
Caution should be observed when creating an SRO between Malware and Malware Analysis objects when the Malware sample_refs property does not contain the SCO that is included in the Malware Analysis sample_ref property.
Note, this property can also contain a reference to an SCO which is not associated with Malware (i.e., some SCO which was scanned and found to be benign.)

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Note
member.summary:
A Note is intended to convey informative text to provide further context and/or to provide additional analysis not contained in the STIX Objects, Marking Definition objects, or Language Content objects which the Note relates to. Notes can be created by anyone (not just the original object creator).
For example, an analyst may add a Note to a Campaign object created by another organization indicating that they've seen posts related to that Campaign on a hacker forum.
Because Notes are typically (though not always) created by human analysts and are comprised of human-oriented text, they contain an additional property to capture the analyst(s) that created the Note. This is distinct from the created_by_ref property, which is meant to capture the organization that created the object.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Note.Abstract
member.summary: A brief summary of the note content.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Note.Content
member.summary: The content of the note.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Note.Authors
member.summary: The name of the author(s) of this note (e.g., the analyst(s) that created it).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Note.ObjectRefs
member.summary: The STIX Objects that the note is being applied to.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ObservedData
member.summary:
Observed Data conveys information about cyber security related entities such as files, systems, and networks using the STIX Cyber-observable Objects (SCOs). For example, Observed Data can capture information about an IP address, a network connection, a file, or a registry key. Observed Data is not an intelligence assertion, it is simply the raw information without any context for what it means.
Observed Data can capture that a piece of information was seen one or more times. Meaning, it can capture both a single observation of a single entity (file, network connection) as well as the aggregation of multiple observations of an entity. When the number_observed property is 1 the Observed Data represents a single entity. When the number_observed property is greater than 1, the Observed Data represents several instances of an entity potentially collected over a period of time. If a time window is known, that can be captured using the first_observed and last_observed properties. When used to collect aggregate data, it is likely that some properties in the SCO (e.g., timestamp properties) will be omitted because they would differ for each of the individual observations.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ObservedData.FirstObserved
member.summary: The beginning of the time window during which the data was seen.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ObservedData.LastObserved
member.summary: The end of the time window during which the data was seen. This MUST be greater than or equal to the timestamp in the first_observed property.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ObservedData.NumberObserved
member.summary:
The number of times that each Cyber-observable object represented in the objects or object_ref property was seen. If present, this MUST be an integer between 1 and 999,999,999 inclusive.
If the number_observed property is greater than 1, the data contained in the objects or object_refs property was seen multiple times. In these cases, object creators MAY omit properties of the SCO (such as timestamps) that are specific to a single instance of that observed data.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ObservedData.Objects
member.summary: (Deprecated), type: observable-container A dictionary of SCO representing the observation. The dictionary MUST contain at least one object. The cyber observable content MAY include multiple objects if those objects are related as part of a single observation. Multiple objects not related to each other via cyber observable Relationships MUST NOT be contained within the same Observed Data instance. This property MUST NOT be present if object_refs is provided. For example, a Network Traffic object and two IPv4 Address objects related via the src_ref and dst_ref properties can be contained in the same Observed Data because they are all related and used to characterize that single entity. NOTE: this property is now deprecated in favor of object_refs and will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ObservedData.ObjectRefs
member.summary:
A list of SCOs and SROs representing the observation. The object_refs MUST contain at least one SCO reference if defined. The object_refs MAY include multiple SCOs and their corresponding SROs, if those SCOs are related as part of a single observation.
For example, a Network Traffic object and two IPv4 Address objects related via the src_ref and dst_ref properties can be contained in the same Observed Data because they are all related and used to characterize that single entity.
This property MUST NOT be present if objects is provided.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Opinion
member.summary: An Opinion is an assessment of the correctness of the information in a STIX Object produced by a different entity. The primary property is the opinion property, which captures the level of agreement or disagreement using a fixed scale. That fixed scale also supports a numeric mapping to allow for consistent statistical operations across opinions.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Opinion.Explanation
member.summary: An explanation of why the producer has this Opinion. For example, if an Opinion of strongly-disagree is given, the explanation can contain an explanation of why the Opinion producer disagrees and what evidence they have for their disagreement.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Opinion.Authors
member.summary: The name of the author(s) of this Opinion (e.g., the analyst(s) that created it).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Opinion._Opinion
member.summary: The opinion that the producer has about all of the STIX Object(s) listed in the object_refs property. The values of this property MUST come from the opinion-enum enumeration. strongly-disagree = 1, disagree = 2, neutral = 3, agree = 5, strongly-agree = 5

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Opinion.ObjectRefs
member.summary: The STIX Objects that the Opinion is being applied to.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Report
member.summary: Reports are collections of threat intelligence focused on one or more topics, such as a description of a threat actor, malware, or attack technique, including context and related details. They are used to group related threat intelligence together so that it can be published as a comprehensive cyber threat story.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Report.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify the Report.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Report.Description
member.summary: A description that provides more details and context about the Report, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Report.ReportTypes
member.summary:
The primary type(s) of content found in this report.
The values for this property SHOULD come from the report-type-ov open vocabulary.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Report.Published
member.summary: The date that this Report object was officially published by the creator of this report. The publication date(public release, legal release, etc.) may be different than the date the report was created or shared internally(the date in the created property).

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.Report.ObjectRefs
member.summary: Specifies the STIX Objects that are referred to by this Report.

member.name: T:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ThreatActor
member.summary:
Threat Actors are actual individuals, groups, or organizations believed to be operating with malicious intent. A Threat Actor is not an Intrusion Set but may support or be affiliated with various Intrusion Sets, groups, or organizations over time.
Threat Actors leverage their resources, and possibly the resources of an Intrusion Set, to conduct attacks and run Campaigns against targets.
Threat Actors can be characterized by their motives, capabilities, goals, sophistication level, past activities, resources they have access to, and their role in the organization.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ThreatActor.Name
member.summary: A name used to identify this Threat Actor or Threat Actor group.

member.name: P:Cti.Stix.Core.SDO.ThreatActor.Description
